title: Hey
content: Hey guys.  Danm its been a while since I played this.  Is there any way I could get this game or other dos games for not dos?(preferably mac but I do have windows)

title: Re: Hey
content:
DOS games not for DOS? Hmm... not sure if many of those sort exsist. Especially for Mac, but you could try [url=http://dosbox.sourceforge.net/]DOSBox[/url], a DOS emulator, to run DOS games on your Mac system.

Welcome to the forums.

EDIT: Oh, and check out 3drealms.com for shareware copies of all their DOS games, including Keen.

title: Re: Hey
content: Yeah, probably only way is to use emulator. Keen isn't ported to any other system, neither are other classics.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Hey
content: I used dos box, it is great.

title: Re: Hey
content: You can download free shareware DOS Games at [url=http://www.dosgames.com]www.dosgames.com[/url]. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [img]http://www.geocities.com/miniopolis/soul.txt[/img]

title: Re: Hey
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]You can download free shareware DOS Games at www.dosgames.com.[hr][/quote]
But [url=http://www.dosgamesonline.com]www.dosgamesonline.com[/url] has many more. DOS games online has well over 500 games.

title: Re: Hey
content:
Some DOS games *will* work on newer computers without needing DOSbox, but not always. Keen works fine on one of my computers but refuses to run on the other...[hr]

RocketJess, blasting off again!

[url=http://www.geocities.com/rocketjess]The Dragonkeeper's Lair[/url]

title: true
content: Usually the only reason to use DOSBox is to get sound.  I can't hear the Adlib music and sound effects without it.  The other solution is to search online for DOS-compatible drivers for your soundcard, but that's not always easy, or even possible.

title: Re: true
content:
hi everyone!
I'm trying to play KEEN using DOSBox, but it says: "Out of memory! Try unloading your TSRs!"
What I need to do?? I want to play but I can't, and I don't know what to dooooooooooo!!!!!
Sorry, I'm crazy, I know... ^^u

Can anyone help me? I can't speak English very well...

title: Re: true

title: Re: true
content:
You'll need to play with your dosbox.conf file. Open it up (it's plain text) and play with the ems/xms settings. I think some combination of those should fix it. There's only four possible configurations, so just try them all.________________
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v462/lemur821/YorpEye.png[/img]
